## PROM Selection and Implementation

### Validated Instruments by Specialty

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| label: tbl-proms
#| tbl-cap: "Validated PROM instruments by surgical specialty"

library(knitr)
library(dplyr)

proms_data <- data.frame(
  Specialty = c("General Surgery", "General Surgery", "Orthopaedics", "Orthopaedics", "Anaesthesia"),
  Instrument = c("EQ-5D-5L", "BODY-Q", "Oxford Hip Score", "WOMAC", "QoR-15"),
  Timepoints = c("Pre-op, 6mo, 12mo", "Pre-op, 3mo, 6mo, 12mo", "Pre-op, 6mo, 12mo", "Pre-op, 6mo, 12mo", "24hr, 7d post-op"),
  Description = c("Generic quality of life", "Body image after surgery", "Hip-specific outcomes", "Knee/hip arthritis outcomes", "Quality of recovery")
)

kable(proms_data)
```

## PROM Workflow Management {#sec-prom-workflow}

### Automated Scheduling

The platform automatically schedules PROM surveys based on:

-   Surgical procedure type

-   Evidence-based follow-up intervals

-   Patient consent preferences

-   Clinical milestone events

### Patient Communication

::: callout-tip
## Patient Engagement Strategies

-   Send reminder emails 3 days before due date

-   Provide mobile-friendly survey links

-   Offer phone support for technical difficulties

-   Send thank you messages after completion
:::

```{mermaid}

flowchart TD
    A[Surgery Completed] --> B[PROM Scheduled]
    B --> C[Patient Notification]
    C --> D{Response Received?}
    D -->|Yes| E[Data Recorded]
    D -->|No| F[Reminder Sent]
    F --> G[Phone Follow-up]
    E --> H[Outcome Analysis]
```
